page.title: 12 Fruit Farming (4)
page.content: The farm has its own generators to run the cold stores in case of power cuts.2000 pounds a month is spent on electricity.Recent changes include selling of considerable amounts of first class fruit (Cox, Crispin and Spartan) for making fruit juice.They are always looking to carry out work more cheaply and to improve the yield per acre.Times are competitive and presentation and quality needs to be higher.There is much competion from other countries.A recent development has been the cold chain.The fruit is taken from cold store into cold store lorries and out into cold store again. Another less recent trend has been the amalgamation of smaller farms,so that now ownership is concentrated in the hands of the fortunate few.Not so many labourers are needed with modern methods and technology.
